answers.answer: No, diabetes is deteted by blood glucose testing, not urine. You can ask your doctor specifically to test for blood sugar if you have concerns

Normally there is very little or no glucose in urine. When the blood sugar level is very high, as in uncontrolled diabetes, the sugar spills over into the urine. Glucose can also be found in urine when the kidneys are damaged or diseased.
do the doctors give you this type of  blood test during a normal check-up or do youhave to ask them for  the specific type?
That really depends on whether there is a reason for concern as well as the doctor's individual practices. I would ask your doctor.

question: can you detect if u have diabetes by a regular check-up with the urine test?
